tagDescription: to Lord Selkirk Re The settling of Immigrants and the state of the Settlement Accounts. The great want of Cattle & Provisions.

to Lord Selkirk No.1 Re The overturning of the expected peace among the Settlers by the N.W.Co Agents at Fort William.Their repeated efforts & success at ruining the Settlement,the attacks of 11th & 16th June,the surrender of himself to the ennemy for peace' sake and condition of Colony in general.Sends his Journal for perusal.
to Lord Selkirk Re The fire at Churchill factory and the parties connected with it.
Journal of Miles McDonell Kept at Red River Settlement from January to April 1817.

to Lord Selkirk No.2 Recommending two young men,John McLeod and Roderick McKenzie to be induced to remain in the Company's service. Also the exemplary conduct of two,John Bourke and Mr.Everard; the warrants served against him by the N.W.Co.; the unfair dealings of Mr.Hillier over proclamation issued.Mr.Archd.McDonald will report fully on Affirs of Settlement.
Journal kept at the Red River Settlements from July 1st 1815 to Aug.2nd 1816. (This Journal comprises the whole of Volume 65,and has nothing to signify by whom it was kept.) by Colin Robertson
Journal No.1 of Miles McDonell kept during his voyage from London to Stornoway and from thence to York Factory in Hudson Bay from July 15 1811 to July 5 1812.
Journal No.2 of Miles McDonell from July 6 1812 to April 22 1813

to Lord Selkirk Detailing the circumstances of the past year at Red River Settlement.Enclosed a sketch of conduct of N.W.Co in Red River. List of emigrants taken from Red River.Henry's charges and answers.Letter from Gentleman of the Council and traders recommending surrender.
to Lord Selkirk Referring to his letters written July 24th at Fort William.Has had warrant for felony served on him but has obtained bail. Has drawn for Â£120 Stg. in favor of Maitland & Auldjo.
Account of furs made at Brandon House 1810-1811.

to Lord Selkirk Refers to his letters of 20 & 25 June & 2nd July and the destruction of the Settlement by the N.W.Co during his imprisonment.Requests that His Lordship obtain extension of leave for his son Donald,from the War Office.He has been furnished a passage to Montreal and will carry this letter.
Journal of Red River kept by William Yorston from May19-1810-May 23 1811.Memo for each day.
to Lord Selkirk Re the condition of R.R.S. on his arrival;the distribution of land and housing of Settlers and the troubles with N.W.Co.
Journal of Miles McDonell No. 4 Kept at Red River Settlement from Apl.7 1815 to 17 June 1815.
Journal No.5 of Miles McDonell Kept from 16 June 1815 to Oct.1815.
York Factory to Lake Winipic.

to Lord Selkirk No.3 Finds that srrender of himself to Enemy has not savec Colony;Settlers & servants driven out and Cattle & Stores seized and houses & buildings burned by the N.W.Co. Informs His Lordship of death of his son Alex.McDonell and brings his other son Donald Oneas to his notice.
Journal of Miles McDonell Kept at Red River Settlement from October 16 1816 to December 31 1816.
Journal of Miles McDonell Kept at Red River Settlements from January to April 1817.
Journal of Miles McDonell Kept at Red River Settlement from 5th April to 30th August 1817.
Sheep Book of Red River for 1810.

Journal No.3 of Miles McDonell Kept at Fort Deer,Ossiniboia,R.R.Forks,Jack River,York Factory,Lake Winipic,The Plains, R.R.Settlement,Hill River,Turtle River & Rat Point-from 22 Apl. 1813 to 7 Apl.1815.
